page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Our area includes the villages of Jump, and part of Hemingfield and the town of Hoyland. Hoyland itself is made up of Elsecar, Hoyland Common, Platts Common. It is part of the Metropolitan Borough of Barnsley being in the County of South Yorkshire. Jump and Hemingfield being small villages orientate themselves towards the town of Wombwell. Hoyland today is a busy small town with a { {population}of approximately 16,000 people and covering 1,999 acres. The name Hoyland means highland because the town is built on top of a hill. It appears in the{Domesday Book}as Hoiland and the land was once owned by King Harold. The town grew up around iron works and coalmines but the ironworks died out in 1880 and the coalmine at Elsecar closed in 1982.
